patterns: What is the admission process for BTech?
How do I apply for Btech?
What are the steps for admission in Btech?

responses.text:
Admission Process for the B.Tech programme:
 1. Admission through JoSAA: 
 Admission to the B.Tech. programmes of the Institute are carried out each year On the basis of performance of the students in the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE-Main) by common counselling through Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA).
 2. Admission under DASA programme 
 3. Admission under Cultural Exchange Programme(ICCR) 
 4. Admission under Study in India Programme(SII)

patterns: What is the admission process for MTech?
How do I apply for Mtech?
What are the steps for admission in Mtech?
responses:
Admission Process for M Tech programme is as follows: 
 1. Admissions to M. Tech. programme of the Institute shall be carried out through Centralized Counselling for M. Tech./M. Arch./M. Plan. Admissions (CCMT) jointly conducted by various NIT’s. For each programme, eligibility is define base GATE paper.

patterns: What is the admission process for M SC?
How do I apply for MSC?
What are the steps for admission in Msc?
responses: Admission to the Institute M. Sc. programmes is conducted at centralized level through Centralized Counselling for M. Sc./M. Sc. (Tech) CCMN based on the performance of the candidates in the Joint Admission Test for M. Sc. (JAM) each year

patterns: What is the admission process for MBA?
How do I apply for MBA?
What are the steps for admission in MBA?

responses.text:
Admission Process for MBA programme is as follows: 
 1. Admissions will be made on the basis of CAT/GMAT/CMAT/MAT/Institute test (70% weightage), Group Discussion (15% weightage), and Interview (15% weightage). At first, the seats will be filled from CAT/GMAT/CMAT/MAT Marks+GD+PI Score. Remaining vacant seats will be filled from Institute’s Test Marks+GD+PI Score.

patterns: Admission process for Btech after JEE Main
How to apply for B.Tech through JOSAA
When is the CSAB seat allotment?

responses.text: JOSAA conducts several rounds of counselling for seat allocation. For detailed information on the process, eligibility, important dates, and more.
CSAB conducts special rounds of counselling for vacant seats after the JOSAA rounds are completed. For details about eligibility, participating institutes, and the counselling process.

OR and CR cutoff for branch EC
How much does the course cost?
What is the fee for this program?
How much does the course cost?
responses:
NIT Jalandhar BTech fees is INR 5 lakh. This is the tuition fee for all the BTech specialisations. Apart from the tuition fees, candidates also have to pay Hostel Charges and One-time Payable Security Fees. Candidates are advised to visit the official website for more details about fees. 
 Students have to pay their semester fee only through online mode (using Netbanking, Debit/Credit Card) by login to NITJ ERP System.

patterns: How can I get a scholarship?
How can I get a scholarship?

responses.text: Scholarships are available for students with outstanding academic performance or those in financial need. For more queries contact Office e-mail ID : scholarshipsection@nitj.ac.in

patterns: How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
What amenities are included in the hostel?

responses.text:
Hostel accommodation is available for students. 
 First year - shared room of 4 students 
 Second and third year - shared room of 2 students 
 Final year - Single room based on availability on first come first serve basis.  
 The facilities of internet, reading room, indoor games, washing machines, fans, washing machines, geyser, water cooler etc. are available in every hostel. Each hostel has a guest room with all basic amenities that can be booked by students for their parents/guests through hostel clerk on the recommendation of warden of the hostel.

patterns: Who is in charge of the mess?
How can I contact the mess committee?
What is the mess menu for today?
What is the mess menu for the week?
Where can I find the mess menu?
How much does the mess cost?
How do I pay the mess fees?
responses: Mess food is available to hostel students on payment of mess advance fees of Rs 25000 per semester. Menu updated each month by hostel students comittee. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served from 8:00am - 9:30am , 12:30pm - 2:00pm and 8:00pm - 9:30pm respectively.

patterns: What placement support do you offer?
What companies visit the campus for placements?

responses.text:
The Training and Placement Office (TPO) at our institute is dedicated to providing students with the skills, resources, and opportunities to successfully enter the professional world. 
 Placement Highlights  : 
- 95% placement rate 
- 12 LPA average package 
- Internship conversion 85% 
- Highest package of Rs 60LPA secured by multiple students.
- Significant placements in IT, Core Engineering and consulting sectors. 
- Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Deloitte, Accenture among the top companies.

responses.text: You can access the college library using your student ID card. Books can be borrowed for a standard period of 14 days, with the option to renew if no one else has reserved the book. For more details, visit the library section on the official website.

responses.text: Cultural events and fests are held regularly. To participate, register for the events through the official fest website or contact the organizing committee. Visit the website for the latest updates.

responses.text: If you have a backlog, you will need to clear it in the subsequent semesters. Supplementary exams are available for backlog clearance. For more details, visit the student ERP portal
The annual cultural fest UTKANSH, which attracts thousands of students across the country to participate in the days of extravaganza comprising of competitions, seminars, symposium and workshops.
The technical fest at NIT Jalandhar is called Techniti. Visit the official fest website for more details.

patterns: How to see a doctor on campus

Is there a pharmacy on campus?
responses: The dispensary is the heartbeat of the institute which provide Treatment for different diseases and also provide first aid to the injured, and also arranges different awareness camp Like cardiac camp, BMD camp etc. In case of medical emergency, the ambulance van is available 24 hours for taking patient(s) to other hospitals for the required treatment.

responses: Mentors and academic advisors are assigned to students at the beginning of the semester. For social outreach or community service, contact the NSS (National Service Scheme) cell. Visit the official website for more information.

patterns: Can I get a medical leave from class?
less than 75% attendance in a subject?
less than 75% attendance in a subject?
responses:
The attendance policy requires students to maintain a minimum of 75% attendance. Medical leave can be granted with proper documentation. Visit the official website for more details on the policy. 
 If you have less than 75% attendance, you may be debarred from appearing for the exam.

NIT Jalandhar, through its Aarogya Club and other initiatives, promotes mental health and well-being through counseling, workshops, and awareness programs, aiming to foster a culture of physical fitness and mental resilience.

patterns: Is there a canteen in campus?
What food is available in canteen?
responses:
The campus has multiple canteens offering a variety of food options:
- Campus Cafe near Lecture Theater
- Night canteen
- The Snackers
-Food options include North Indian, South Indian, Chinese and fast food items.

Available shops in campus:
- Stationery and photocopy center
- College co-operative store
- Medical store
- Fruit and juice stalls
- Snack shops
- Book store 

Timings: 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM

patterns: How to prepare for semester exams?
What if I miss an exam?

responses.text:
Exam Information for First Year Students:

- Two main exams per semester: Mid-semester  and End-semester 
- Passing criteria: Minimum 40% in theory and practical separately
- Grading system: 10-point scale (S=10, A=9, B=8, etc.)
- Back papers: Can reappear in next semester if failed
- Exam pattern: 3-hour written papers + practicals/vivas

Exam schedules are displayed on notice boards 3 weeks prior. Previous year papers available in central library.
